doc.name: intersect
doc.summary: Returns true if two objects overlap, false otherwise.

example.p: if intersect(graphic "spaceship", graphic "asteroid", "opaque pixels") then endGame

description.overview: Use the intersect function to determine whether one object obscures part of another object, or whether one object is over another object.

parameter.name: threshold
parameter.description: The amount of transparency that pixels in the objects must have in order to be counted during the intersect calculation.

option.description: An integer between 0 and 255 which specifies a threshold that the alpha value of each pixel must be greater than or equal to in order to be counted during calculation of the intersect.
(Equivalent to using an alpha value of 0) Specifies that the intersect is calculated using the rect of the two objects.
(Equivalent to using an alpha value of 1) Specifies that the intersect is calculated using pixels of the objects that have are not completely transparent, ignoring completely transparent areas.
(Equivalent to using an alpha value of 255) Specifies that the intersect is calculated using only pixels that are completely opaque.

description.value: The intersect function returns true or false.
description.comments:
If both objects are stacks or cards, the intersect function returns true if the stack windows overlap.
The intersect function uses screen coordinates for stacks and cards, and window coordinates for controls. This means that if one object is a stack or card and the other is a control, the intersect function does not return a reliable result.
